author: Priyanka Koul
title: Dense Fog Disrupts Delhi-NCR: Flight and Train Delays Cause Inconvenience - The Daily Guardian
text: Delhi-NCR experienced a hazy morning on Friday as the cold wave continued to hold its grip on Northern India, resulting in dense fog. Despite a slight improvement in fog conditions at the Indira Gandhi International Airport, the lowest visibility was recorded at 150 meters, with the Runway Visual Range (RVR) ranging from 400 to 800 meters, according to the India Meteorological Department. The thick fog led to delays in several flights at the Delhi Airport, affecting both arrivals and departures. Additionally, Delhi-bound trains faced delays due to low visibility. The Meteorological Departmentâ€™s forecast warned of the possibility of visibility reducing to 50 meters in very dense fog and improving to 400 meters in moderate fog at the IGI airport. Passengers voiced their grievances over the inconvenience caused by the delays. A traveller, Mohd Shahrukh, expressed frustration as his flight was delayed by nearly three hours, impacting attendance at an important event. He stated, â€œA lot of people are facing difficulties due to the delay of flights.â€ The impact of dense fog extended to trains as well. Subhash, another passenger, highlighted delays affecting eight trains that were supposed to reach the previous night and uncertainty about their arrival times. The low visibility on roads due to dense fog also posed challenges for morning commuters. The India Meteorological Department has issued predictions of dense to very dense fog conditions across North Indian states for the next two days, cautioning travellers and urging caution on the roads.

author: Terrace
title: Appeal From Brazilian Women On Peace Mission In the Middle East
text:
Above photo: Protest in SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil, Nov. 4, 2023. â€˜No to the occupation of Gaza. Down with Israelâ€™s genocide of Palestinians.â€™
This appeal was sent by Marcia De Campos Pereira in Brazil, former president of the International Federation of Democratic Women. The women in Brazil who issued it are asking progressive organizations in the U.S. to add their signatures.
April 30, 2024. In memory of Mayada Abassi, Former Ambassador of Palestine to Brazil and Secretary of International Relations of the General Union of Palestinian Women (UGMP).
Letter to the Brazilian Government, entities and leaders of communities in Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, and the Community of Portuguese-Speaking Countries (CPLP):
The Brazilian Union of Women (UBM), the Brazilian Center for Solidarity with the People and Fight for Peace (CEBRAPAZ) and the International Democratic Federation of Women (FDIM), actively listening to â€œPalestinian Women, the Pillar of Resistance,â€ engaged in the fight for Peace and in Defense of Palestine, sought to give visibility to Palestinian women because they, together with children, have been more than 70 percent of the people murdered by Israel.
Palestinian women have always been an integral part of the struggle for freedom and emancipation of their people. The history of Palestinian resistance is full of names of heroines, activists who refused to remain silent and without action while Palestine was colonized.
In addition to the many names recorded in Palestinian history, there are thousands of combative and heroic women who have always been â€œand will still beâ€ part of this history of resistance: they are grandmothers, mothers, sisters, friends, comrades. They are in a permanent struggle and resistance for the right to exist and for their children and grandchildren to live with dignity.
Stop genocide in Palestine! Lula, break relations with Israel! SÃ£o Paulo, Nov. 4, 2023.
However, Israel refuses to give up the territory it illegally occupies, to dismantle its apartheid system, to respect international law and the rights of the Palestinian people. To this end, it maintains a ruse into which it intends to drag the United States and other allies. Israelâ€™s strategy is to break isolation by attacking disaffected governments, such as Iran, in order to drag the entire region into an unprecedented conflict.
The key to avoiding a regional war is a permanent ceasefire in Gaza, allowing humanitarian aid delivery and assistance, recognition of the â€œPalestinian Stateâ€ with an end to the Israeli occupation, and a fair peace agreement.
Responding to the calls for active listening by â€œPalestinian Women, the Pillar of Resistanceâ€ and the outcry of statements from Palestinian institutions and intellectuals, we are making some necessary propositions for immediate and forceful action with the Brazilian government, as well as urging entities and leaders of communities in Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean and the Community of Portuguese-Speaking Countries (CPLP), with the leading role in the â€œLula tem RazÃ£o!â€ [Lula is Correct] movement, from the Global South.
In this way, we position ourselves against the lies disseminated by â€œZionist propagandaâ€ in the mainstream press, which has been distorting the facts and reality of the legitimate and just cause for emancipation and the right to self-determination of the Palestinian People.
That said, we echo the calls for â€œactive listeningâ€ with this hearing:
1st Appeal: For harassed and imprisoned women
The Israeli army, steadily and daily, is implementing policies of retaliation and revenge against Palestinian women and girls, carrying out beatings, domestic vandalism and humiliation, without taking into account their privacy, by invading homes, especially those of Palestinian women who were detained and recently released. We express our aim to promote a feminist mobilization to support Palestinian women, expose the crimes committed against them by the occupation and exert pressure on governments and parliaments to take responsibility to stop the denial of womenâ€™s rights in Palestine, considering that recently there was an escalation in the detentions of Palestinian women and girls, based on reprisals against political-ideological tendencies and the use of the detained as hostages. It is necessary to mention that there are currently 81 women detained in Israeli prisons in precarious health conditions, the majority of them in Damoun prison, without medical assistance and at risk to their lives. 2nd Appeal: To end the supply of weapons to Israel
The continuous supply of arms and ammunition from the United States and allied countries to Israel, encouraging it to wage war and aggressive actions, and pledging to protect it militarily and politically, will always encourage Israel to go further in its crimes, which gradually increased to the level of genocide. We call on human rights, humanitarian and civil rights organizations and militants active in countries of the Global North to follow the example of their French counterparts in bringing legal action against European governments that support Israel with weapons, holding them accountable for supporting Israel in its crimes and obliging them to stop exporting weapons and ammunition to Israel and to refrain from providing political cover for their crimes. We demand that governments break contracts for weapons and ammunition, consultancy and provision of services in public security and environmental management with the State of Israel, such as the partnership contracts between Brazil and Argentina with Mekorot (Israelâ€™s main national water agency) in the region of Patagonia for the administration in water management and basic sanitation. 3rd Appeal: To freeze diplomatic relations
We appeal to international public opinion to pressure the occupying authority to avoid a catastrophe in Rafah, at a time when the Israeli occupation army continues its bloody attack on all areas of the destroyed Gaza Strip and the West Bank, including occupied Jerusalem. As we address this appeal to the Brazilian government and the leaders of Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, as well as the Community of Portuguese-Speaking Countries (CPLP), among others that maintain diplomatic relations with Israel, we urge them to freeze their relations with Israel in order to avoid the invasion of Rafah and a military confrontation that could escalate into a war against Iran. Any country that maintains diplomatic relations with this [Israeli] entity, which, under current circumstances, threatens Palestinian existence and all Arab national security, will tarnish its own image. It is an ethical and moral duty of states to suspend relations with a country that violates the norms of international law. 4th Appeal: To the resistance of the working class
We call on activists and organizations from around the world to establish May 1, 2024, International Workers Day, as â€œPalestinian Resistance Workers Day,â€ aiming to highlight the need to defend the Palestinian resistance in its right to fight for its liberation, strengthening it at a higher level against the oppression of workers around the world. We make this call at this decisive moment in the developing worldâ€™s revolt against U.S. imperialism and the countries of the North to affirm that the path for the labor movement to re-establish itself on a global scale as an agent of revolutionary transformation is to courageously ally with the liberation struggles of the Global South and mobilize workers towards this objective. 5th Appeal: For freedom of the press and communication
The Freedoms Committee of the Palestinian Journalists Union denounced Israel for continuing to target and close media institutions in occupied Jerusalem, while insisting on the decision preventing satellite TV channels from operating in Jerusalem, in addition to banning journalists from working on press coverage in Jerusalem, around the Al-Aqsa Mosque, in the Occupied West Bank and mainly in Gaza, where journalists have been deliberately targeted in murderous and systemic attacks, including against their families, with the destruction of equipment, work and their homes. It is essential to support and subsidize legally and diplomatically the Palestinian Journalists Union in its tireless efforts and demands to prosecute Israel for its crimes, including murder, aggression and impeding the exercise of journalistic activity in Palestine at all levels, regional and international, while reporting Israelâ€™s crimes that meet the legal requirements of war crimes tribunals and international tribunals, as freedom of the press and expression is a cornerstone of human rights. These are principles that must be respected. 6th Appeal: For academic and scientific freedom
Professor Shalhoub-Kevorkian was arrested by Israeli police on April 18, 2024, on suspicion of inciting terrorism and violence because of her unwavering stance against the genocide in Gaza and her insightful analysis of Israeli settler colonialism and its racialized violence. Her arrest, during which she suffered psychological torture and ill-treatment, follows an ongoing campaign of harassment, including a letter demanding that she resign from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem for signing a ceasefire declaration. The treatment of intellectuals and academics in Israeli prisons exemplifies a systematic pattern of â€œeducacideâ€ against Palestinian academics and educational institutions. Furthermore, the fact that an internationally renowned academic is being detained and persecuted in this way will have a chilling effect on academic freedom and solidarity with Palestine. We call on you to sever all ties and cease all collaboration and joint projects of any kind with universities and research institutes that maintain this persecutory pattern against academics, intellectuals and students/researchers until they put an end to their decades-long collaboration with the Israeli occupation and the apartheid system, in defense of academic and scientific freedom. The organizations that produced this letter invite other interested organizations, institutions and groups to sign the letter, in a joint effort to support Palestinian women and promote peace in the region. Interested parties can contact us via email at ubmbrasil.mulheres@gmail.com and editores_recos@terra.com.br to join the initiative.
Access the letter in full with the updated list HERE: https://abrir.link/ LGwPc
This letter represents a collective effort for justice, solidarity and peace in Palestine, demonstrating the importance of international unity and mobilization in times of conflict and injustice.

author: Diego Ariza
title: IndignaciÃ³n en el fÃºtbol colombiano: otro equipo histÃ³rico cambiarÃ­a de sede - Infobae
text:
Al igual que Alianza Petrolera, otro equipo en Colombia dejarÃ¡ su plaza, en la que tiene muchos hinchas, para buscar un mejor estadio - crÃ©dito Colprensa La temporada 2024 del fÃºtbol colombiano se ha llenado de polÃ©micas que continuaron desde 2023, desde disturbios con los aficionados, escÃ¡ndalos de los directivos y con jugadores, asÃ­ como los problemas por falta de salarios y estadios con malas condiciones.
Respecto a los escenarios deportivos, uno de los equipos histÃ³ricos considerarÃ­a el cambio de sede para encontrar un estadio con mejor infraestructura , pero sacrificando una buena cantidad de aficionados en su ciudad, asÃ­ como la tradiciÃ³n que tiene en la regiÃ³n.
Ahora puede seguirnos en nuestro WhatsApp Channel y en Facebook .
El caso se parecerÃ­a al de Alianza, que dejÃ³ Barrancabermeja despuÃ©s de 23 aÃ±os de jugar en el estadio Daniel Villa Zapata para pasar a Valledupar, donde en pocas ocasiones llenÃ³ el Armando Maestre, disputÃ³ la Copa Sudamericana y al principio sufriÃ³ lÃ­os por el estado de la gramilla.
Cambio inesperado y polÃ©mico Lo que pasÃ³ con Alianza, que tenÃ­a un estadio remodelado y buena aficiÃ³n en Barrancabermeja, para irse a Valledupar y crear hinchada nuevamente, causÃ³ preocupaciÃ³n en el fÃºtbol colombiano porque los dueÃ±os de los conjuntos se enfocarÃ­an mÃ¡s en la bÃºsqueda de recursos que en los simpatizantes.
AtlÃ©tico Huila pasarÃ­a por esa situaciÃ³n y dejarÃ­a Neiva para jugar en Barrancabermeja , lo que serÃ­a un cambio muy polÃ©mico para el paÃ­s porque los opitas se convirtieron en una imagen tanto del departamento como de la cultura y tradiciÃ³n de su gente.
AsÃ­ se encuentra el Estadio Guillermo Plazas Alcid, en su tribuna de occidental - crÃ©dito @jmilte7/X El periodista Miler Pinto Cobos, en la emisora Antena 2 , explicÃ³ que la razÃ³n de esa idea es porque los directivos de los huilenses estÃ¡n inconformes con el estadio Guillermo Plazas Alcid , que desde 2016 detuvo las obras de remodelaciÃ³n por el fallecimiento de cuatro trabajadores por la caÃ­da de una placa de concreto en la tribuna de occidental, que actualmente no permite el ingreso de pÃºblico.
â€œTodo estÃ¡ muy encaminado, tiene que pasar algo extraordinario para que eso se caiga. El tema estadio fue fundamental, de seguir asÃ­, el cambio serÃ­a a partir del 2025â€³, fue lo que tambiÃ©n seÃ±alÃ³ el diario La NaciÃ³n , consultando a una fuente cercana al Huila.
Por el momento, no hay pronunciamiento de los opitas respecto a este caso, que llegarÃ­a al estadio Daniel Villa Zapata que no tiene uso desde diciembre de 2023, tiene capacidad para 12.000 personas en dos tribunas con silleterÃ­a, palcos, camerinos y un buen estado de la cancha.
El estadio Daniel Villa Zapata se encuentra listo para volver a recibir partidos del fÃºtbol colombiano - crÃ©dito @gomez_deportivo/X RenovaciÃ³n urgente Maruan David Issa, presidente del AtlÃ©tico Huila, le habrÃ­a advertido tanto a las autoridades de la AlcaldÃ­a de Neiva como a los directivos que si no hay avances en las reparaciones del Guillermo Plazas Alcid, la decisiÃ³n serÃ­a el cambio de sede a un escenario con mejores condiciones.
â€œYo ya hablÃ© con el alcalde y el gobernador, de igual forma hablÃ© con la barra Alta TensiÃ³n Sur en Neiva, les hablÃ© algo que va a pasar si no vienen cambios reales â€, dijo el dirigente en junio, citado por La NaciÃ³n , y que causÃ³ preocupaciÃ³n porque serÃ­a una decisiÃ³n tomada.
Felipe Victoria, director de Inder Huila, le dijo a ese medio que se adelantaron estudios para la renovaciÃ³n de la tribuna de occidental â€œy unos anÃ¡lisis muy importantes con distintas universidades, entre ellas la Universidad Nacional de BogotÃ¡, la Universidad Nacional de Manizales y la Universidad de Antioquiaâ€.
Por su parte, el alcalde GermÃ¡n Casagua mencionÃ³ que el objetivo es que se firme la adjudicaciÃ³n para las obras del estadio Guillermo Plazas Alcid en 2024: â€œEstamos haciendo todo el esfuerzo en conjunto con la GobernaciÃ³n del Huila para que las obras comiencen este aÃ±o, dejando adjudicado el contrato y que el 2025 sea pleno de ejecuciÃ³n de obra â€.
AtlÃ©tico Huila, cuyos dueÃ±os son los mismos del Independiente del Valle, se han esforzado en mejorar las condiciones del estadio Guillermo Plazas Alcid para sus jugadores e hinchas - crÃ©dito AtlÃ©tico Huila â€œCon la bendiciÃ³n de Dios, esperamos poder estar entregando el estadio a finales del aÃ±o prÃ³ximo o a comienzos del 2026 . Quiero aprovechar la oportunidad para expresarle a los neivanos que fue un compromiso de campaÃ±a y que estamos plenamente seguros que en este Gobierno, el estadio de Neiva volverÃ¡ a tener su aforo del 100%â€, seÃ±alÃ³.

title: Arsenal pincha de local y sacude la Premier League; Liverpool y Luis DÃ­az sonrÃ­en
text: El Arsenal cerrÃ³ la jornada nÃºmero 19 de la Premier League 2023/2024 con derrota, y cayÃ³ 2-0 en condiciÃ³n de local en el Emirates Stadium ante el West Ham United, perdiendo asÃ­ la posibilidad de recuperar el liderato de la tabla de posiciones. Pese a que dominaron y tuvieron muchas ocasiones, los dirigidos por Mikel Arteta, en especial Saka, no supieron terminar las jugadas a la hora de definir y se vieron rÃ¡pidamente en desventaja. Al final, los visitantes sÃ­ aprovecharon las pocas oportunidades de gol que generaron y se quedaron con los 3 puntos.Cabe recordar que el Liverpool venciÃ³ 2-0 el martes pasado al Burnley y quedÃ³ como Ãºnico lÃ­der de la liga inglesa durante el tradicional â€˜Boxing Dayâ€™, en el que el Aston Villa tambiÃ©n perdiÃ³ 3-2 contra el Manchester United, que parece haber superado su crisis.Ante un gran marco en el estadio de Turf Moor, el equipo de JÃ¼rgen Klopp abriÃ³ el marcador con un ajustado disparo de Darwin NÃºÃ±ez desde la frontal a los 6 minutos, mientras que sobre el final del partido el colombiano Luis DÃ­az asistiÃ³ al portuguÃ©s Diogo Jota , quien asegurÃ³ la victoria.Resultados â€˜Boxing Dayâ€™ Martes Newcastle - Nottingham Forest 1-3.Bournemouth - Fulham 3-0.Sheffield United - Luton 2-3. author: Alessia Passafiume
title: Ottawa versera 47,8 milliards sur 10 ans aux PremiÃ¨res Nations pour rÃ©former la protection de lâ€™enfance | Le Devoir
text:
Lâ€™AssemblÃ©e des PremiÃ¨res Nations (APN) et le gouvernement fÃ©dÃ©ral ont finalisÃ© mercredi soir un accord qui verra le gouvernement fÃ©dÃ©ral dÃ©penser 47,8 milliards de dollars pour rÃ©former les programmes de protection de lâ€™enfance au cours des 10 prochaines annÃ©es.
La cheffe nationale de lâ€™APN, Cindy Woodhouse Nepinak, a fait cette annonce au dernier jour de lâ€™assemblÃ©e gÃ©nÃ©rale annuelle de lâ€™APN Ã  MontrÃ©al, deux jours seulement aprÃ¨s avoir dÃ©clarÃ© aux chefs quâ€™une offre avait Ã©tÃ© prÃ©sentÃ©e sur la table, mais quâ€™elle ne pouvait pas encore en discuter publiquement.
Bien que son annonce ait Ã©tÃ© accueillie avec acclamations, des inquiÃ©tudes subsistaient, jeudi, parmi certains qui lâ€™accusaient, elle et lâ€™APN, de travailler en catimini pour finaliser un accord qui affecterait leurs enfants pour les gÃ©nÃ©rations Ã  venir.
Lâ€™entente vise Ã  rÃ©parer des dÃ©cennies de discrimination Ã  lâ€™Ã©gard des enfants des PremiÃ¨res Nations, retirÃ©s de leur famille et placÃ©s en famille dâ€™accueil parce que les systÃ¨mes de protection de lâ€™enfance dans les rÃ©serves nâ€™Ã©taient pas suffisamment financÃ©s pour fournir des services susceptibles de maintenir lâ€™unitÃ© des familles.
Â« Il y a eu tellement de douleur et de prÃ©judices causÃ©s par cette politique raciste de protection de lâ€™enfance dans chacune de nos communautÃ©s des PremiÃ¨res Nations et dans nos familles Â», a rappelÃ© M me Woodhouse Nepinak, lors dâ€™une confÃ©rence de presse.
Ã€ lire aussi La rÃ©conciliation entre Ottawa et Autochtones passe par lâ€™exploitation des ressources, plaide Poilievre Le gouvernement fÃ©dÃ©ral est responsable de la protection de lâ€™enfance dans les rÃ©serves, et les gouvernements provinciaux des programmes de protection de lâ€™enfance partout ailleurs. Mais le financement dâ€™Ottawa Ã©tait Ã  Ã©galitÃ© avec celui des provinces en matiÃ¨re de placement familial, car ils devaient payer des agences provinciales pour fournir ce service aux tarifs provinciaux.
Lâ€™APN devrait ratifier lâ€™accord au cours dâ€™une assemblÃ©e extraordinaire en septembre.
Changement fondamental La ministre des Services aux Autochtones, Patty Hajdu, a versÃ© quelques larmes alors que M me Woodhouse Nepinak discutait de lâ€™accord monumental auquel ils Ã©taient parvenus.
Â« Câ€™est une tentative dâ€™apporter un peu de paix aux familles, aux communautÃ©s et aux peuples des PremiÃ¨res Nations qui ont subi lâ€™odieux du colonialisme Ã  travers ce que je qualifierais de politique la plus cruelle, qui consiste Ã  sÃ©parer les familles Â», a mentionnÃ© la ministre.
Le chef rÃ©gional de lâ€™Ontario, Abram Benedict, a affirmÃ© que lâ€™accord marque un changement fondamental dans la relation entre les PremiÃ¨res Nations et Ottawa.
Â« Je peux vous dire quâ€™en tant que membre de lâ€™Ã©quipe de nÃ©gociation, nous sommes satisfaits de lâ€™accord que nous avons obtenu. Autrement, nous ne lâ€™aurions pas proposÃ© Â», a-t-il mentionnÃ©, remerciant la ministre Hajdu pour son soutien. Â« Câ€™est rÃ©volutionnaire. Â»
Il a ajoutÃ© que les peuples des PremiÃ¨res Nations vont maintenant entamer le processus de discussion de lâ€™accord sur ses mÃ©rites. Â« Câ€™est dÃ©sormais entre les mains de nos communautÃ©s. Â»
Accord bonifiÃ© Lâ€™accord vaut plus du double de ce qui avait Ã©tÃ© initialement promis pour une rÃ©forme Ã  long terme dans un accord de rÃ¨glement rÃ©sultant dâ€™une plainte Ã¢prement disputÃ©e en matiÃ¨re de droits humains concernant le sous-financement des services de protection de lâ€™enfance.
Le Tribunal canadien des droits de la personne a statuÃ© que le Canada avait fait preuve de discrimination Ã  lâ€™Ã©gard des enfants des PremiÃ¨res Nations en raison du sous-financement chronique des programmes de protection de lâ€™enfance.
Le montant initial Ã©tait prÃ©vu Ã  20 milliards de dollars . Un montant distinct de 23 milliards a Ã©tÃ© rÃ©servÃ© pour indemniser les enfants et les familles lÃ©sÃ©s par le systÃ¨me.
Les familles qui ont contribuÃ© au lancement du procÃ¨s initial se sont tenues aux cÃ´tÃ©s du ministre et du chef national pour annoncer la nouvelle.
PrÃ©occupations et dissidence Le processus visant Ã  parvenir Ã  cet accord historique a Ã©tÃ© entachÃ© par les prÃ©occupations des chefs de tout le pays, la protection de lâ€™enfance dominant les conservations en marge, les rÃ©solutions de derniÃ¨re minute et les rÃ©unions Ã  huis clos, bien quâ€™elles aient Ã©tÃ© pour la plupart effacÃ©es sur lâ€™ordre du jour initial.
Quatre chefs rÃ©gionaux qui siÃ¨gent aux cÃ´tÃ©s de M me Woodhouse Nepinak au comitÃ© exÃ©cutif de lâ€™AssemblÃ©e lui ont Ã©crit en juin des lettres dÃ©nonÃ§ant ses efforts pour parvenir Ã  un accord, affirmant quâ€™elle outrepassait son mandat en prenant des dÃ©cisions qui affecteraient directement les enfants et les familles des PremiÃ¨res Nations sans leur consentement.
Les chefs Bobby Cameron, Terry Teegee, Ghislain Picard et Joanna Bernard reprÃ©sentent plus de la moitiÃ© des PremiÃ¨res Nations du Canada.
Ils ont Ã©galement accusÃ© lâ€™APN dâ€™avoir tentÃ© dâ€™exclure la SociÃ©tÃ© de soutien Ã  lâ€™enfance et Ã  la famille des PremiÃ¨res Nations du processus, bien quâ€™ils aient dÃ©posÃ© conjointement une plainte en matiÃ¨re de droits de la personne concernant le sous-financement par Ottawa des services de protection de lâ€™enfance dans les rÃ©serves.
M me Woodhouse Nepinak a niÃ© ces allÃ©gations et a dit que les chefs pourraient consulter lâ€™accord avant quâ€™il ne soit votÃ© lors dâ€™une assemblÃ©e spÃ©ciale des chefs Ã  lâ€™automne.
Elle a Ã©galement promis dâ€™Ã©couter les commentaires quâ€™elle recevrait.
Â« Vous nous avez demandÃ© dâ€™aller chercher un accord avec le Canada. Vous nous avez poussÃ©s Ã  maintes reprises Ã  continuer de nÃ©gocier dans le bon sens, a-t-elle rappelÃ© aux chefs. Je reÃ§ois des directives de votre part. Pas des agences, ni de lâ€™APN, ni du personnel, ni de qui que ce soit dâ€™autre, mais des chefs. Â»
Elle a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© le montant en dollars lors dâ€™une rÃ©union Ã  huis clos avec les chefs et leurs mandataires , mardi.
Au cours de cette rÃ©union, elle a parlÃ© des risques politiques de ne pas accepter lâ€™accord qui est sur la table, selon une source prÃ©sente dans la salle, mais qui a demandÃ© lâ€™anonymat parce quâ€™elle nâ€™Ã©tait pas autorisÃ©e Ã  partager les dÃ©tails publiquement.
Ce risque fait rÃ©fÃ©rence au fait quâ€™une Ã©lection fÃ©dÃ©rale se profile Ã  lâ€™horizon et quâ€™un nouveau gouvernement dirigÃ© par les conservateurs est envisageable.
Lorsquâ€™on lui a demandÃ© ce qui se passerait en cas de changement de gouvernement lâ€™annÃ©e prochaine, M me Woodhouse Nepinak a rÃ©pondu quâ€™il existe un engagement financier que le prochain gouvernement, Â« en thÃ©orie Â», ne sera pas en mesure de renier.

author: Lucca Hoelzle
title: NBA registra maior audiÃªncia da rodada de Natal dos Ãºltimos 5 anos nos EUA
text:
Em meio ao debate sobre a queda de audiÃªncia da NBA nos Estados Unidos, a liga conseguiu uma grande resposta nesta quarta-feira (25). Isso porque a tradicional rodada de Natal da liga registrou a maior audiÃªncia da data nos Ãºltimos cinco anos. De acordo com dados da Nielsen Fast Nationals divulgados pela prÃ³pria liga , a mÃ©dia de espectadores foi de 5,25 milhÃµes. Assim, resultou em um aumento de 84% em relaÃ§Ã£o Ã  rodada de 2023.
MOST-WATCHED CHRISTMAS DAY IN 5 YEARS ðŸŽ
The NBA delivered its most-watched Christmas Day in five years, with viewership up 84% vs. last year across ABC, ESPN, ESPN2, Disney+ and ESPN+. The NBA on Christmas Day averaged 5.25 million viewers per game in the U.S.
The matchupâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/DVviJzMiKa
â€” NBA (@NBA) December 26, 2024 Ainda segundo os nÃºmeros, o duelo eletrizante entre Los Angeles Lakers e Golden State Warriors teve a maior audiÃªncia. O encontro entre LeBron James e Stephen Curry contou com mÃ©dia de 7,76 milhÃµes de espectadores. Registrou ainda um pico de 8,32 milhÃµes na reta final, que terminou com a vitÃ³ria dos Lakers apÃ³s o game winner de Austin Reaves. A partida registrou nÃ£o sÃ³ a maior audiÃªncia dos Ãºltimos cinco anos para um compromisso da rodada de Natal, mas tambÃ©m em relaÃ§Ã£o a qualquer outro jogo de temporada regular no perÃ­odo.
Outro destaque de peso foi o confronto entre Denver Nuggets e Phoenix Suns , que fechou a noite. Uma mÃ©dia de 3,84 milhÃµes de pessoas assistiram ao duelo de Nikola Jokic e Kevin Durant , registrando a maior audiÃªncia da histÃ³ria de uma partida realizada no Ãºltimo horÃ¡rio. AlÃ©m disso, terminou com um aumento de 161% em relaÃ§Ã£o ao Ãºltimo ano, quando Dallas Mavericks e os prÃ³prios Suns se enfrentaram.
#NBAXmas had it all!

â€” NBA (@NBA) December 26, 2024 Rodada de Natal da NBA bate recordes tambÃ©m nas redes sociais Para alÃ©m dos excelentes nÃºmeros registrados nas transmissÃµes, a rodada de Natal tambÃ©m teve sucesso absoluto nas redes sociais. A NBA divulgou que os materiais veiculados em seus perfis oficiais atingiram mais de 500 milhÃµes de visualizaÃ§Ãµes. Certamente, a presenÃ§a das principais estrelas como Luka Doncic, Anthony Edwards, Victor Wembanyama e companhia ajudaram no crescimento das impressÃµes.
Por fim, para finalizar o relatÃ³rio, a liga informou que as partidas tambÃ©m alcanÃ§aram os melhores nÃºmeros da histÃ³ria do NBA League Pass. As partidas alcanÃ§aram 214 paÃ­ses e territÃ³rios, e foram transmitidas em 60 lÃ­nguas diferentes.

author: Tim Baker
title: 'Escalation serves no one': Sir Keir Starmer calls on Israel and Hezbollah to agree ceasefire in address to UN | Politics News | Sky News
text: Sir Keir Starmer has called for Israel and Hezbollah to agree to a ceasefire, saying \"escalation serves no one\". Speaking at the United Nations General Assembly, the prime minister implored the two sides to \"step back from the brink\". It comes after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said his nation's troops would keep \"fighting at full force\" and that news of a potential ceasefire deal was \"not true\". Addressing the nations of the world in New York, Sir Keir said: \"I call on Israel and Hezbollah: Stop the violence, step back from the brink.\" Israel-Hezbollah latest: Follow live updates here The UK prime minister added: \"We need to see an immediate ceasefire to provide space for a diplomatic settlement, and we are working with all partners to that end. \"Because further escalation serves no one.\" In his speech, Sir Keir said the UN needs to \"work together for peace, progress and equality\" - including \"preventing a regional war in the Middle East\". More criticism of Russia Earlier in his trip to the UN, Sir Keir criticised Russia for invading Ukraine in a meeting of the security council.Both the UK and Russia are permanent members of the UN Security Council. Addressing the general assembly, Sir Keir hinted at wanting to take further action against Russia for its invasion. He said: \"We must put new energy and creativity, into conflict resolution and conflict prevention, reverse the trend towards ever-greater violence, make the institutions of peace fit for purpose, and hold members to their commitments under the UN Charter.\" Addressing the security council previously, Sir Keir said: \"The greatest violation of the charter in a generation has been committed by one of this council's permanent members.\" Pension to be invested in climate change During his speech, the prime minister repeated many of his previous pledges on UK domestic policy. However, he did appear to make one new announcement. Sir Keir pledged to put \"billions\" from pension and insurance funds into \"fighting climate change\" and \"boosting development\". The Labour government has repeatedly said it wants to use more private investment to build growth. Sir Keir added that the plans for pensions and insurance funds would be managed through a new facility at British International Investment - part of the Foreign Office - working alongside the City of London. The prime minister said \"innovating\", \"thinking differently\" and \"moving faster\" were the sort of approaches needed to deliver benefits into the future. ðŸ‘‰ Click to subscribe to the Sky News Daily wherever you get your podcasts ðŸ‘ˆ Just before Sir Keir began speaking, it was confirmed he would later be meeting Donald Trump ahead of the US election in November. However, it seems unlikely that he will be able to meet with Democrat Kamala Harris on the current visit.
